column1: Hibbing is a city in Saint Louis County
column3: United States. The population was 16
column4: 361 at the 2010 census. The city was built on the rich iron ore of the Mesabi Iron Range. At the edge of town is the largest open-pit iron mine in the world
column5: the Hull–Rust–Mahoning Open Pit Iron Mine. U.S. Highway 169
column9: and 1st Avenue are five of the main routes in Hibbing. The Range Regional Airport offers daily commercial flights between Hibbing and Minneapolis-St. Paul
column10: as well as hosting many private pilots and the Minnesota Department of Natural Resources fire fighting aircraft.

column1: Hibbing Heights was platted in 1908 and annexed by Alice in 1910
column2: when Alice incorporated as a city. Between 1919 and 1921
column3: the Village of Hibbing was moved immediately south of Alice and then annexed Alice in 1920. Hibbing remained a village until 1979 when the Town of Stuntz was annexed. An Article of Incorporation was filed in July 1979 with the state and Hibbing became a city from that action in January 1980.

column3: agreed to develop the downtown buildings with low interest loans that could be paid off over the years by the retailers. New civic structures such as Hibbing High School
column6: and the Rood Hospital were also constructed with mining company money. In all
column7: about 200 structures were moved down the First Avenue Highway

column11: "an enormous pile of kindling". The move started in 1919 and the first phase was completed in 1921. Known today as "North Hibbing"

column1: Hibbing has a humid continental climate (Koppen: Dfb)
column3: but with long
column4: drawn out winters. Summers are generally warm to hot
column5: while winters are generally cold to severely cold. A freeze has been recorded for every month of the year.

=== Newspapers ===
The Hibbing Daily Tribune newspaper was founded in Hibbing in 1893 and serves readers in Saint Louis County.  It is published daily, except Monday, with a circulation of 3,749 in 2019.  The newspaper is currently owned by the Adams Publishing Group.


== Sister cities ==
Hibbing has one sister city:

 Walsrode, Lower Saxony (Germany)
